moves.1. d4 Nf6 2. e3 g6 3. c3 Bg7 4. Bc4: 4d3 is Colle. not a bad choice, This loses a move to ...d5.
moves.4... O-O 5. Nd2 d5 6. Bd3: At this point, game is about even.
moves.6... Nbd7 7. h3 c5 8. Ngf3 Re8 9. dxc5 N: both missed 15....Ne4! wins the c pawn and unleashes Black's bishops.
moves.16. Bd2: Bb2 might be a smidge better.
moves.16... Ne4 17. Ba4 Re7 18. Rc1 Qd6 19. Qe: both are ignoring the open file. Does White have sufficient support to make this attack be important? i think not.
moves.26... d4: the answer to a wing attack is a well prepared center attack. or so the pundits say.
moves.27. cxd4 exd4 28. exd4: 28.Nxd4 might be a little better than this. keep pawn islands to a minimum.
moves.29... Bxf3 30. Qxf3 Qxf3 31. gxf3 Nf5: Now white's pawns are weak everywhere. all islands.
moves.32. d5 Nxh4: 32....Nd4 is better seeking to eliminate one of the bishops. the isolated pawns will wait.
moves.33. Rd3 Nf5 34. Rc5 Nd4 35. Bd1: 35.Ba5 better.  after ...Ra7, Bb2 the d button does not fall immediately.
moves.39. Kf1 Re5 40. Rxe5 Bxe5 41. Bxe6: after this move, White's King must stay to stop the h-pawn, accordingly the b4 button will fall to the K+B. interesting game.
